title: Well Engineer - HLP Job at WTS Energy
content:
WTS Energy - Our client, Heritage Energy Operational Services Limited (HEOSL) is a leading indigenous energy company in Nigeria, committed to delivering safe, efficient, and sustainable energy solutions. As the operator of the OML 30 asset, HEOSL plays a pivotal role in Nigeria's oil and gas sector, focusing on maximizing production while adhering to the highest standards of environmental and operational excellence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Well Engineer - HLP
Job Location: Lagos 
Department: Well Engineering

Job Summary

	This HLP role provides a structured exposure to well planning, drilling operations, and well integrity management.

Key Accountabilities


	Assist in the preparation of well designs, drilling programs, and time/cost estimates.
	Support daily drilling operations, including monitoring performance and managing drilling records.

title: Human Resource Assistant Job at Prixair Group
content:
Prixair Group is a dynamic and diversified company committed to excellence across various industries including hospitality, beauty, events, logistics, media, and lifestyle services. With a passion for delivering world-class experiences, Prixair has built a strong reputation for quality, professionalism, and innovation.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Driven by a customer-first philosophy, Prixair Group continuously sets industry benchmarks through exceptional service delivery, operational efficiency, and a dedicated workforce. Our diverse portfolio of brands works seamlessly together to provide top-tier solutions that meet the evolving needs of individuals and organizations. From premium spa treatments to event planning, media production, transport, and hotel management, Prixair Group is dedicated to creating value and inspiring trust across every touchpoint.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Assistant

Job Location: Gaduwa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Human Resources
Reports To: HR Officer

Job Summary


	The Human Resource Assistant provides administrative and operational support to the HR department.
	This role assists in recruitment, employee records management, onboarding, training coordination, and other HR functions to ensure smooth day-to-day operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist with recruitment processes including posting job ads, scheduling interviews, and communicating with candidates.
	Maintain and update employee records, files, and databases.
	Support onboarding and orientation for new hires.
	Track employee attendance, leave requests, and HR documentation.
	Ensure proper filing of confidential HR documents in compliance with policies.
	Prepare HR documents such as employment contracts, letters, and reports.
	Handle employee inquiries and direct them to the appropriate HR personnel.
	Help coordinate training sessions, workshops, and performance appraisals.
	Assist with organizing staff events, welfare activities, or health programs.
	Support compliance with labor laws and company policies.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Human Resource Management, Business Admin, or a related field.
	1 - 2 years of relevant experience (internship or full-time).
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Detail-oriented and proactive with strong multitasking ability.


Preferred Skills:


	Basic knowledge of HR software or HRIS systems.
	Familiarity with Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices.
	Strong interpersonal skills and a supportive attitude.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to: amandaosifoedwards@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Data Analyst Job at Bottleking Limited
content:
Bottleking Limited, the Minister of Enjoyment, at 27 Castle Rock Ave, Lekki Peninsula II, Lekki 105102, Lagos. We specialize in offering an exquisite selection of exotic wines and premium drinks. Our dedication to quality and customer satisfaction has made us a trusted name in the beverage industry. At Bottleking, we believe in celebrating life's moments with the finest drinks from around the world. Join us and experience the true taste of luxury.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help improve BottleKing’s business performance.
	You will transform raw data into meaningful insights and dashboards, support strategic initiatives, and help optimize inventory, pricing, customer experience, and sales trends.


Key Responsibilities


	Collect, organize, and interpret data from sales, inventory, marketing, and customer feedback.
	Analyze trends, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights to inform business decisions.
	Monitor KPIs, identify data discrepancies, and recommend improvements in processes or strategy.
	Conduct competitor and market analysis to inform pricing and promotional strategies.
	Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Excel, or Tableau.
	Collaborate with departments (Sales, Marketing, Procurement, Logistics) to understand data needs and support projects.
	Present data findings to management in clear, concise formats.
	Maintain databases and ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security.
	Support demand forecasting and restocking decisions using historical and real-time data.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis role (Retail or FMCG experience is a plus).
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, etc.) and SQL etc
	Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio etc
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication skills – able to translate data into understandable insights.
	Detail-oriented, with a keen eye for identifying trends and anomalies.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience in retail data analytics (especially in the wine or beverage sector).
	Knowledge of inventory and POS systems.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple data-related tasks concurrently.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work with a passionate and growth-oriented team.
	Career development and learning opportunities.
	Dynamic work environment in a rapidly growing retail company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short Cover Letter to: hr@bottleking.ng using "Data Analyst Application - BottleKing" as the subject of the email.
